text: Lil idea here, but I am beginning to use DND areas so content editors can add custom modules to build a page. It would be super nice if there was a way to filter available modules based on their location ala the same way you can filter templates based on directory location in the DM. That way I could create a specific directory with friendly modules for them to use and they would only see those.
right now there are 91 modules in our instance…..

One thing I've done in the past is name all  the modules in a group with a "tag" or certain naming convention, so that when you search, they pop up.

For example:
• Hero (Douglas Module)
• Filter (Douglas Module)
• Testimonial (Douglas Module)
So then you can at least search "Douglas" (or whatever you choose) and they'll all pop up
This is just the name in the Label field:

<@U019XUWS3EK> what does this mean for modules that are currently in use? for eg, in an html template, if you have `{% _module_ "module_XXXXXXX" path="/my-directory/my_module", label="my_module" %}` but then you change the module name?
I am always hesitant to rename modules because of where they are referenced in html templates
You should be okay, because it's just changing the label (not the actual module name) - so it won't affect the dependencies.
In the example here, the module name is still `hero` but changing the label allows you to search for it when adding to a template
Ours are called "Pinecone"s and here's what happens when you search, within a template:
If you are using themes, you “promote” your custom modules that go along with your theme here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes#theme-modules>
Makes it look like this in the editor: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/theme%20modules.png?width=6264&name=theme%20modules.png>
